Philadelphians have attended *too* many funerals and seen *too* many memorials on street corners.

They've become numb to gun violence because the Republicans who run the PA House and Senate would rather do the NRA‚Äôs bidding than #EndGunViolence.

While police and North Philly residents dodged a hail of bullets, a block away, 80 kids were trapped for hours in their daycare center.

August 14th, 2019 will forever be etched in their mind -- fear, concern, & confusion -- hearing bullets just a few feet away. #GiveUsAVote

For some parts of Philadelphia, it is a war zone -- residents are afraid of going outside their house because of the barrage of bullets that possibly await them.
 
If we want to tackle gun violence in black communities, we need to address poverty & inequality once and for all.

If "good guys with a gun" barely made it out alive, and 50 more officers outside couldn‚Äôt stop the suspect immediately ‚Äì what makes you think that a civilian carrying a gun can always defend themselves and others around them? ü§î

Mitch McConnell is failing the American people. Plain and simple. 

He refuses to call the Senate back into session while the majority of Americans are calling for concrete action to #EndGunViolence ‚Äì enough is enough!

Dial 202-224-3121 & urge him to #GiveUsAVote!
Black mothers in Philly are at the forefront of tackling gun violence in the city. Their work must not be forgotten!

In addition to easy access to guns, gun violence occurs in black communities bc of the lack of economic investment in neighborhoods, stagnant job growth, lack of funding for our public schools, hopelessness, etc.

It's more than a drug deal gone wrong or a turf war between gangs.

Philadelphians are angered by the lack of inaction from @PASenateGOP & @PAHouseGOP, who swore to serve and protect ALL citizens, but block Philadelphians from passing protections for ourselves.
 
Enough of the NRA talking points, do your job! #GiveUsAVote

While I'm glad everyone joined me in praying for the six injured PHL police officers, let me remind you that essentially every day there is a mass shooting in my city ‚Äì and there‚Äôs never national news coverage!
 
My community wants solutions -- they want to #EndGunViolence.

LIVE NOW: I‚Äôll be speaking at a news conference about gun violence with @PhillyMayor, @PhillyPolice Commissioner Richard Ross, @GovernorTomWolf, @SenBobCasey, @Darrell_Clarke, @SenSharifStreet & @RepKenyatta.

Tonight I pray for the Philly police officers & their families.
